H0.text: The production of sugar is the main function of cellular respiration, a process that cells perform to support an organism’s survival and growth.

H1.text: The release of energy is the main function of cellular respiration, a process that cells perform to enable an organism to survive and grow.

H2.text: The formation of new proteins for the cell is the main function of cellular respiration, a process that cells perform to support an organism’s survival and growth.

H3.text: The removal of waste products from the cell is the main function of cellular respiration, a process that cells perform many different processes that an organism needs to survive and grow.

A4.text: Respiration is one of the key ways a cell releases chemical energy to fuel cellular activity.

A5.text: The chemical energy stored in ATP can then be used to drive processes requiring energy, including biosynthesis, locomotion, or transportation of molecules across cell membranes.
